coverage: Granular Isaiah 1–66: prophet and household, disciples and sign-acts; Judean kings and officials (Eliakim, Shebna, Joah), Assyrian envoys; expanded nations (Elam, Media, Arabia, Dumah, Tarshish, Seba/Sheba); Zion personifications (Ariel, Valley of Vision, Watchmen); expanded divine/messianic figures (Servant—collective and individual, Spirit, Redeemer, Arm of the LORD); polemics (idols/craftsman parody, Bel/Nebo); Scripture/liturgical entities (Book of the LORD, sealed scroll, new song); highway motif, covenant renaming (Hephzibah/Beulah), cup of wrath; apocalyptic complex (24–27) with banquet, death swallowed, resurrection, Leviathan; historical crises (Syro‑Ephraimite, Assyrian siege, Hezekiah’s sign and envoys); Comfort–New Exodus (40–55), house of prayer for all peoples (56), Zion’s light (60–62), and new creation (65–66).
id_scheme: Cross-book stable by (type+primary-slug) with alias support; deterministic for new entries; reuses YHWH/Zion/Leviathan/Hezekiah/Solomon where present.

entries.name: Isaiah son of Amoz
entries.blurb: Jerusalem court prophet spanning the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah. His ministry unites holy vision (ch. 6) with political counsel (7–8; 36–39) and eschatological comfort (40–66). Later tradition remembers his martyrdom (sawn in two; cf. Heb 11:37).

entries.name: The LORD (YHWH), the Holy One of Israel
entries.blurb: Isaiah’s keynote divine title—God’s moral majesty set within covenant love. Holiness is not aloofness but purifying fidelity that judges and restores.

entries.name: Historical frame: Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, Hezekiah
entries.blurb: Late 8th–early 7th century BCE: Assyria ascendant, Syro‑Ephraimite war, Sennacherib’s invasion, and the Babylonian horizon.

entries.name: Prophetess (Isaiah’s wife)
entries.blurb: Shares Isaiah’s vocation in a sign‑act pregnancy; the household itself becomes prophetic theater.

entries.name: Shear‑jashub (‘A remnant shall return’)
entries.blurb: Accompanies Isaiah to meet Ahaz; his name pledges judgment‑through‑survival and anticipates post‑exilic hope.

entries.name: Maher‑shalal‑hash‑baz (‘Swift spoil, speedy prey’)
entries.blurb: Child’s name warns Damascus and Samaria—history can turn on a word; plunder is imminent.

entries.name: Bind up the testimony; seal the teaching among my disciples
entries.blurb: Isaiah gathers a circle of learners; his children are ‘signs and portents’—a prophetic community shaped by Scripture.

entries.name: Isaiah’s naked sign‑act
entries.blurb: Three‑year enacted parable warning against trust in Egypt/Cush—political alliances undress a nation.

entries.name: Uzziah (Azariah) king of Judah
entries.blurb: Prosperity and pride culminate in a leprous end (cf. 2 Chr 26). In the year of his death, Isaiah saw the Lord—earthly thrones fade before the heavenly.

entries.name: Jotham king of Judah
entries.blurb: Steady yet overshadowed; his reign bridges stability to the crisis under Ahaz.

entries.name: Ahaz king of Judah
entries.blurb: Refuses the sign, courts Assyria, and installs syncretism—fear without faith corrodes public life.

entries.name: Hezekiah king of Judah
entries.blurb: Trusts God under siege; prays and receives deliverance. Yet his post‑healing pride with Babylonian envoys forecasts exile. Fifteen years added to his life.

entries.name: Eliakim son of Hilkiah
entries.blurb: Given ‘the key of the house of David’—a peg fastened in a sure place; replaces the proud steward Shebna.

entries.name: Shebna the steward/scribe
entries.blurb: Self‑promoting official demoted by oracle; warns leaders against vanity amid crisis.

entries.name: Joah son of Asaph (recorder)
entries.blurb: Court recorder in the Hezekian delegation to the wall; a witness to Rabshakeh’s propaganda.

entries.name: Blind watchmen, mute dogs (failed shepherds)
entries.blurb: Leaders addicted to gain and sleep—satire exposes spiritual negligence that imperils the flock.

entries.name: Eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths
entries.blurb: From exclusion to memorial and a name better than sons and daughters—holiness makes hospitality.

entries.name: Tiglath‑Pileser III (Pul) of Assyria
entries.blurb: Expansionist monarch who reshaped the Levant; Judah’s temptation to trust him becomes a theological failure.

entries.name: Shalmaneser V of Assyria
entries.blurb: Begins the siege of Samaria—history’s gears grind toward exile.

entries.name: Sargon II of Assyria
entries.blurb: Takes Ashdod; Isaiah’s sign dramatizes Egypt/Cush’s futility.

entries.name: Sennacherib of Assyria
entries.blurb: Boasts against the God of Israel; his army is struck in a night—empire meets the Angel of the LORD.

entries.name: Tartan and Rabsaris (Assyrian envoys)
entries.blurb: Military and palace officials accompanying Rabshakeh—Assyria’s intimidation is bureaucratic as well as brutal.

entries.name: Rabshakeh (field commander)
entries.blurb: Master of psychological ops—targets language, identity, and faith; Isaiah reframes his speech as blasphemy to be answered by prayer.

entries.name: Merodach‑Baladan of Babylon
entries.blurb: Envoys court Hezekiah after his recovery; flattery sets a trap—Isaiah prophesies future Babylonian exile.

entries.name: Cyrus the Great of Persia
entries.blurb: Named as YHWH’s ‘shepherd’ and ‘anointed’ to release exiles and rebuild—monotheism meets realpolitik in a stunning providence.

entries.name: Assyria
entries.blurb: Rod of God’s anger yet judged for arrogance; yoke shattered on Zion’s hill.

entries.name: Babylon
entries.blurb: Prideful archetype destined for downfall; stage of exile and theater of new exodus.

entries.name: Elam and Media
entries.blurb: Instruments raised against Babylon—empires are tools in a sovereign hand.

entries.name: Philistia
entries.blurb: Admonished not to gloat—serpent imagery escalates judgment metaphors.

entries.name: Moab
entries.blurb: Lament over Moab with a messianic refuge in David’s tent—steadfast love enthrones justice.

entries.name: Damascus (Aram)
entries.blurb: Falls with Ephraim; fading splendor catechizes dependence on God.

entries.name: Ephraim/Israel (Northern Kingdom)
entries.blurb: Northern partner in the crisis; oracles of judgment tempered by remnant hope.

entries.name: Egypt
entries.blurb: From false refuge to future worshiper—altar in Egypt and highway with Assyria prophesy reconciliation.

entries.name: Cush (Ethiopia)
entries.blurb: Envoys on the Nile; sign‑act exposes geopolitical vanity.

entries.name: Tyre (Phoenicia)
entries.blurb: Merchant queen humbled; wealth will later ‘belong to the LORD’ for holy service.

entries.name: Edom (Bozrah)
entries.blurb: Stage for judgment visions; a winepress image depicts the day of vengeance.

entries.name: Arabia (Kedar, Tema)
entries.blurb: Desert tribes in both doom and doxology—judgment and praise ring through the tents.

entries.name: Dumah (Edom oracle)
entries.blurb: Watchman’s riddle from Seir—morning comes, and also night; hope and warning entwined.

entries.name: Coastlands / Isles
entries.blurb: Distant peoples summoned to court and song; horizon of mission widens beyond Israel.

entries.name: Ships of Tarshish
entries.blurb: Symbol of global trade and human pride; later they ferry sons and wealth to Zion’s light.

entries.name: Seba and Sheba
entries.blurb: Nations and riches reoriented to Zion; ransom language and pilgrimage converge in worship.

entries.name: Zion / Daughter of Zion
entries.blurb: City as bride and mother—purged, renamed, and radiant; from judgment to jubilee, Zion becomes a house of prayer for all peoples.

entries.name: Ariel (Jerusalem, ‘altar hearth’)
entries.blurb: Siege‑stricken Jerusalem called ‘Ariel’—altar imagery frames both judgment and deliverance.

entries.name: Valley of Vision (Jerusalem under critique)
entries.blurb: City parties amid peril; leaders secure waterworks but neglect the Maker—fatal pragmatism.

entries.name: Daughter Babylon
entries.blurb: Pampered ruler dethroned; exposure of occult pride—humiliation invites repentance yet receives justice.

entries.name: City of Chaos (tohu)
entries.blurb: Uncreation imagery—sin disintegrates civic order into formlessness; only God’s kingdom endures.

entries.name: Watchmen on your walls, O Jerusalem
entries.blurb: Intercessory sentinels who will not keep silent until Zion is established—a liturgy of persistence.

entries.name: Seraphim
entries.blurb: Fiery throne‑room beings; a coal touches Isaiah’s lips—guilt removed, sin atoned.

entries.name: Immanuel (‘God with us’)
entries.blurb: Sign to the house of David that God is with His people amid siege; later echoed at the incarnation without erasing the 8th‑century horizon.

entries.name: Royal Child: Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace
entries.blurb: Ever‑expanding government in justice and righteousness from David’s throne—messianic hope surpassing any immediate heir.

entries.name: Branch / Shoot from the stump of Jesse
entries.blurb: Spirit‑anointed ruler judges with righteousness; knowledge of the LORD fills the earth—creation reconciled.

entries.name: Servant of the LORD — Israel (collective)
entries.blurb: Blind yet chosen; called to be a light to the nations—Israel’s vocation named before its healing.

entries.name: Servant of the LORD — Suffering and Vindicated (individual)
entries.blurb: Gentle justice, worldwide mission, obedient suffering, bearing iniquities, and exaltation—the hinge of Isaiah’s gospel.

entries.name: The Arm of the LORD
entries.blurb: Metonym for God’s saving power—new exodus strength laid bare to the nations.

entries.name: Spirit of the LORD / Holy Spirit
entries.blurb: Creative outpouring, anointing for justice, covenantal indwelling, and grieving presence; pneumatology braided through Isaiah’s hope.

entries.name: Redeemer / Kinsman for Zion
entries.blurb: Go’el language recasts exodus grace for exile—God Himself comes as Zion’s kinsman‑redeemer.

entries.name: Leviathan (twisting serpent)
entries.blurb: Chaos‑dragon pierced by YHWH—cosmic victory frames the vineyard’s restoration.

entries.name: Idols and the craftsman parody
entries.blurb: Trial speeches mock the maker who warms himself with half the wood and worships the rest—monotheistic satire exposes the folly of carved gods.

entries.name: Bel and Nebo (Babylonian gods)
entries.blurb: Idols stoop and bow; they cannot save but must be carried—contrast with the God who carries His people.

entries.name: The Book of the LORD (seek and read)
entries.blurb: Prophetic writings as covenant court record—what is written will not fail.

entries.name: Sealed scroll and illiteracy motif
entries.blurb: Revelation unopened by both learned and unlearned—pride and apathy blind a people to the Word.

entries.name: Highway motif (Way of Holiness / New Exodus)
entries.blurb: A prepared road for the redeemed—wilderness becomes thoroughfare; nations join the pilgrimage.

entries.name: New song and barren woman’s song
entries.blurb: Creation and nations are summoned to fresh praise; the barren sings—grace outruns former desolation.

entries.name: Cup of wrath removed and given
entries.blurb: Jerusalem drinks the cup of staggering; God takes it from her hand and gives it to oppressors—justice meets mercy.

entries.name: Hephzibah and Beulah (new names)
entries.blurb: Forsaken becomes My‑Delight‑Is‑In‑Her; Desolate becomes Married—marital joy as civic restoration.

entries.name: Stone of stumbling and tested cornerstone
entries.blurb: God Himself a sanctuary and a snare; yet He lays in Zion a sure foundation—faith vs. presumption.

entries.name: Swords into plowshares (Zion’s instruction)
entries.blurb: Nations stream to Torah; war‑craft becomes agriculture—shalom is taught, not stumbled into.

entries.name: Isaiah’s Little Apocalypse
entries.blurb: Cosmic judgment and song: city of chaos falls; a banquet on the mountain; death swallowed; resurrection sung; Leviathan slain.

entries.name: Banquet on the mountain
entries.blurb: A feast of rich food and well‑aged wine; God wipes tears and removes reproach—joy becomes public policy of the kingdom.

entries.name: Death swallowed up; tears wiped away
entries.blurb: From shroud to celebration—resurrection hope breaks into prophetic poetry.

entries.name: Your dead shall live; my dead body shall arise
entries.blurb: A rare Old Testament overture to bodily resurrection; dew of light falls on the land of shades.

entries.name: Judgment of Edom (Bozrah) and the Winepress
entries.blurb: Garments spattered from treading the winepress alone—imagery of the day of vengeance and year of redemption.

entries.name: Desert blossoms like the crocus
entries.blurb: Hands strengthened, knees firm; blind see, deaf hear—creation healed and pilgrims sing on the Way of Holiness.

entries.name: Final gathering and universal worship
entries.blurb: All nations and tongues come to see the glory; from new moon to new moon, all flesh worships before the LORD.

entries.name: Call & commission of Isaiah
entries.blurb: Trisagion vision; coal‑cleansed lips; a hardening ministry until holy seed remains—judgment that preserves a stump.

entries.name: Syro‑Ephraimite crisis & waters of Shiloah
entries.blurb: Ahaz refuses trust; Immanuel sign given; gentle waters rejected bring Assyria’s flood.

entries.name: Woes and the Vineyard Song
entries.blurb: Beloved’s vineyard yields wild grapes; six woes expose greed, drunkenness, injustice, and cynicism.

entries.name: Additional ‘woes’ against scoffers and alliance‑makers
entries.blurb: Unjust decrees, covenant with death, reliance on Egypt—prophetic ‘woe’ sharpens conscience.

entries.name: Assyrian invasion & overnight deliverance
entries.blurb: Rabshakeh’s propaganda collapses before prayer; the angel strikes the camp—trust outlasts terror.

entries.name: Hezekiah’s sickness, sign of the shadow, and Babylonian envoys
entries.blurb: The shadow retreats ten steps; boastful display invites future loss—healing must be stewarded with humility.

entries.name: Comfort–New Exodus program
entries.blurb: Voice in the wilderness; shepherding God; trial of idols; Servant’s mission and passion; Zion’s restoration—return from exile as gospel template.

entries.name: Everlasting covenant & Davidic mercies
entries.blurb: Free invitation to the thirsty; covenant fidelity to David extended to nations—mission by mercy, not merit.

entries.name: House of prayer for all peoples (eunuchs & foreigners)
entries.blurb: Holiness without hostility; Sabbath‑keeping becomes solidarity across boundaries.

entries.name: Zion’s light and nations’ pilgrimage
entries.blurb: Arise, shine—glory draws kings; gates open continually; new names (Hephzibah/Beulah) celebrate marital reconciliation.

entries.name: New heavens and new earth
entries.blurb: Long life, peaceable creation, and universal worship—final vision crowns the book.
